intro: Scorzonera autumnalis, commonly known as autumn scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is known for its hairy stems and yellow to orange flowers. Scorzonera autumnalis has a taproot that is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine. It blooms in late summer to early autumn, adding color to the landscape during the transition into winter.
